headline: Stocks in March are having a splendered Bull run
content: Bull markets generally take place when the economy is strengthening or when it is already strong. A bull is an investor who expects prices to rise and, on this assumption, purchases a security or commodity in hopes of reselling it later for a profit. A bullish market is one in which prices are generally expected to rise.

headline: Stocks in February are Excelent
content: Bull markets generally take place when the economy is strengthening or when it is already strong.
